headline.seo: W.H.O. Tool Helps Assess Which People Need Bone-Building Drugs
headline.print_headline: As Bones Age, Who’s at Risk for Fracture?
headline.main: As Bones Age, Who’s at Risk for Fracture?

docs.lead_paragraph: The World Health Organization has devised a risk calculator for fractures that, if used properly, could help doctors and patients decide whether to use drug therapy.
docs.snippet: The World Health Organization has devised a risk calculator for fractures that, if used properly, could help doctors and patients decide whether to use drug therapy.

headline.main: As Bones Age, Who's at Risk for Fracture?

docs.abstract: Jane E Brody Personal Health column discusses osteoporosis and risks and benefits of potential treatments; photo (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: For the millions of Americans with bones that are thinning as they age, this question arises: Who should be treated with bone-enhancing drugs? Until recently, many doctors and drug companies that make these medications were saying almost everyone -- especially older white women, who are at highest risk of one day suffering an osteoporotic fracture.
docs.snippet: The World Health Organization has devised a risk calculator for fractures that, if used properly, could help doctors and patients decide whether to use drug therapy.
